abstracts.cdata!:
The primary objective of the Second
            Electric Power Reconstruction Project is to restore electric
            power supply at least cost.  The project will help to
            restore the generation, transmission and distribution
            systems to meet at least part of the expect increase in
            demand within Bosnia and Herzegovina (BiH), reconnect many
            consumers still without power after the war, and reduce
            power outages, variations in voltage level, and other
            quality of service defects.  The secondary object is to
            improve cost recovery.  The project components include: (a)
            rehabilitation of the hydropower stations of Rama, Jajce 1,
            Caplijina, Trebinje 1 and 2, and Bocac; and the coal-fired
            power stations of Tuzla (Second Phase), Kakanj (Second
            Phase), Gacko, and Uglejvik; (b) rehabilitation of
            transmission facilities in the Federation, Republika Srpska,
            and between them; (c) reconstruction and rehabilitation of
            distribution networks in the Federation and Republika
            Srpska; (d) rehabilitation of coal mines associated with the
            coal power stations of Tuzla, Kakanj, Gacko, and Uglejvik;
            and (e) technical assistance consisting of a transmission
            and institutional rehabilitation study, a coal sector
            restructuring study, and engineering and project management support.
